text: Kari Sallinen (born September 24, 1959) is a Finnish orienteering competitor. He was the first Finn who won the Individual World Orienteering Championships. The competition was held in the year 1985 in Bendigo, Australia.World Orienteering Championship, senior statistics 1966-2006 (Retrieved on January 8, 2007) He was also part of the Finnish team that obtained bronze in the 1981 Relay World Championship in Thun, Switzerland. ==See also== * Finnish orienteers * List of orienteers * List of orienteering events ==References== Category:1959 births Category:Living people Category:Finnish orienteers Category:Male orienteers Category:Foot orienteers Category:World Orienteering Championships medalists
title: Kari Sallinen
